description: I do not know why.
won't work at all
This simply doesn't do anything but starting.
Happy to see that it works, contrary to what comments said. Maybe depends on the distribution.
People say it doesn't work, but it works

Works fine once you close the option menu just below the search box. Hit "X" and it will find the word if you spell it right. If you misspell the word it will not auto correct for you. Once that menu is open it will not show the word until you "X' out even if you spell it correctly.

Pro: it tells you about the word that you spelled
Con: it does nothing if you spell a word incorrectly
It does the job. Works fine on ubuntu 20.04.
found 1 word..then it wouldnt find any word at all..even the ones it had already found before
It's working quite well on my PC
The Snap Package as of April 17th 2021 runs okay, but displays like the proper fonts aren't installed. The version in the repo works great though, and displays properly.

It has a lot of small bugs that are irritating: every one of the options in the View menu doesn't work, unless you search a word first. The sidebar opens and stays open when you search a word that doesn't exist. The find bar randomly collapses (last I checked). The dictionary view is in some sort of caret-browsing mode. I think there are more problems.

BUT it is a functional dictionary though.
Won't install. Garbage
Install and error

I'm using the standard Ubuntu 18.04 - 64 bit. 

I wanted an online dictionary in order to quickly check my spellings of particular obtuse words. My desktop publishers/word processors each have spelling checkers, but they don't also give the meanings to enable me ensure that I'm using the correct word.

I first read all the reviews regarding this application. Despite the majority of people stating "It Doesn't Work". A few users said it did work so I went ahead and installed it.

The first time I ran the application I was presented with a message to the effect -"Default Dictionary not Found". This was not a good start!

I pressed the accompanying "Ok" button and was presented with a blank white square with no text but a few 'hieroglyphs'. Again hardly useful to a new user with NOTHING to suggest appropriate action. 

I started clicking on the hieroglyphs and managed to call up a box which suggest that here was where a particular dictionary would be named. Still nothing to prompt or guide me. 

Further clicking on the hieroglyphs then suddenly called up an impressive list of dictionaries. 

Ok. Lets Copy & Paste a dictionary name. No! Copy & Paste do not work! 
After further random clicking I suddenly found that a dictionary HAD now transferred to the appropriate box. 

I tested the dictionary with several words and sure enough - it worked very well.

Bearing in mind previous comments of others regarding spellings, I then tried with a word deliberately misspelled by just one letter! I was greeted with "Error - No definition found for ~~~".!!

Dictionaries are predominantly used for the checking the correct spelling of a particular word. Checking the actual meaning of a word is used by most people somewhat less than the checking the spelling.

This dictionary, although having a very good concept is appallingly coded by somebody of the opinion "If I know how it works then everybody else will know as well." The many reviews here speak for themselves. The application is certainly NOT intuitive to use and many others have given up and uninstalled it.

Finding and selecting "Help" simply points the user to the 'Gnome Help', apparently for using Ubuntu, not the dictionary. Again, this indicates careless and sloppy code writing.

As somebody who now does a lot of writing and needs to check the spellings of similar sounding words with different meanings, I cannot advise the use of this application. 

However, if you are simply reading literature, you already have the correct spelling and are looking up a meaning of a word it will probably be acceptable for you.

Be prepared to click in the most unlikely places to get a result. Although the concept is good this is a very poorly coded application.

Thanks for reading this far.

Thisisi.
summary: I don't like it!. It's a great idea but with poorly written code

description: Install and immediate error
Uninstalling immediately after installing it, and not finding anywhere to add any dictionaries within a reasonable amount of time.

You only need to add a source in the preferences on first launch. you can add more dictionary sources, a feature I have seen in no other dictionaries.
